author: Sarah Edworthy
title: Sailing in Greece: which islands should I visit?
text: More holiday options in Greece There is no more beautiful sailing destination than Greece. The blue-hued seascape of island clusters, rocky coves and sandy beaches immortalised in Homer’s Odyssey is gloriously accessible to sailors of all ambitions. Numerous options are available to rent sailing boats, motor launches, with or without a skipper. Here is a brief rundown of the exquisite sailing territories: The Saronic Islands and Argolic Gulf Close to Athens, wonderful sailing routes offer calm waters and characterful islands to explore such as Aegina, Poros, Hydra and Spetses. You find well-organised port facilities at Nafplion and Tolo and marinas in Porto Heli, Astros and Leonidio. The Cyclades Known for their melterni, or strong winds, and famous for whitewashed houses, sun-kissed beaches and cosmopolitan lifestyle, must-visit islands include Milos, Folegandros, Santorini, Paros, Naxos, Koufonisia, Donoussa, Kea,Tinos and Mykonos. Seagulls and dolphins often escort your way. Ocean joy: take a magical sailing trip Photo: Region of North Aegean Municipality of Chios The Dodecanese Islands Treasured for their climate, paradise beaches and archaeological wonders, the beautiful island groups offer harbours big and small on Rhodes, Kos, Kalymnos, Patmos, Leros, and Kastelorizo as well as smaller islands. The Ionian Islands Lying off the west coast in open sea, this region comprises the myth-wraithed Corfu, Paxi and Antipaxi, Lefkada, Ithaki, Kefalonia, Zakynthos, Meganissi, Kalamos and Kythira. Winter sailing on calm seas The so-called “short summer” in January is a good time to appreciate the beauty of Greece as you drop anchor to mingle with locals in tavérnas and feel part of island culture. Popular ports include Spetses, an island with a naval history and lovely beaches to sail around. You can tour the island by horse-drawn carriage or bike. Visit the house of Bouboulina (a heroine of the 1821 War of Independence) and have a shot of ouzo at the old shipyard. Hydra, with its yachtie heritage, is well equipped for visiting sailors. There are thermal springs, ancient ruins and craggy volcanic features to explore On land, its bucolic coastline path is dotted with villages, old bridges, and small chapels. Póros, an archaeological paradise built like an amphitheatre on two hills, is home to the ruins of the Temple of Poseidon and the Zoodóhos Pigi Monastery. Sail via the surrounding islets of Boúrtzi, Modi, with its Mycenean shipwreck, and Daskaleió before heading towards the peninsula of Méthana. Here, there are thermal springs, ancient ruins and craggy volcanic features to explore. Race calendar Some like to sail serenely, but for those who appreciate the challenge of harnessing the wind, there is a variety of races to watch or in which to participate, each with colourful local traditions. Competitors are highly skilled crews; courses change from year to year. Classic Yacht Races takes place by the waters of Corfu and Spetses in mid June with yachts and crews from all over the world, though the Aegean Rally, held in the third week of July, is the oldest sailing competition event in Greece, covering an area of 500 nautical miles, typically starting off Piraeus and racing via points in the Cyclades and Dodecanese to finish in Attica. Sea quest: The Classic Yacht Race Towards the end of July, the Rodos Cup offshore race hares around the Dodecanese while up in Halkidiki, competitors in the North Aegean Cup, organised by the Nautical Club of Thessaloniki since 1978, relish offshore sailing in the North Aegean Sea as well triangle sailing. The North Aegean Crossing is to be held (2015) on August 10-15, from Porto Carras to Tsesme in Turkey and on to Samos Island. Earlier in August, the International Ionian Sailing Week celebrates its 26th event with crews navigating past the verdant slopes of Corfu, Lefkada, Kefalonia, Zante and Ithaca. August is also the month for the annual Aegean Regatta. Numerous offshore races such as the Corfu Cup Regatta, the Hellenic Match Racing Tour and the Catamarans Cup International Regatta are scheduled for September and October. • Read more about Greek travel at Holidays in Greece
